<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_file_size:
```c
lfs_soff_t lfs_file_size(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)file);
    LFS_ASSERT(lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));

    lfs_soff_t res = lfs_file_size_(lfs, file);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_size -> %"PRIu32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_file_size:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_ASSERT(test) assert(test)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static bool lfs_mlist_isopen(struct lfs_mlist *head,
        struct lfs_mlist *node) {
    for (struct lfs_mlist **p = &head; *p; p = &(*p)->next) {
        if (*p == (struct lfs_mlist*)node) {
            return true;
        }
    }

    return false;
}
...
static lfs_soff_t lfs_file_size_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    (void)lfs;

#ifndef LFS_READONLY
    if (file->flags & LFS_F_WRITING) {
        return lfs_max(file->pos, file->ctz.size);
    }
#endif

    return file->ctz.size;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The LFS_LOCK(cfg) macro is defined as ((void)cfg,0), so the assignment int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg); always yields err == 0. The subsequent controlling expression if (err) is therefore invariant (always false). This is a direct violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (controlling expressions shall not be invariant); none of the stated exceptions (infinite-loop invariants or the do-while constant-false exception) apply here.
